sub_topic: Solving nonlinear equations using Newton-Raphson method
message_1: Determine the root of the function f(x) = x^3 - 4x^2 + 3x + 1 using the Newton-Raphson method. Start with an initial guess of x = 2 and iterate until the absolute error is less than 0.001.
message_2:
To apply the Newton-Raphson method, we first need to find the derivative of the function f(x) = x^3 - 4x^2 + 3x + 1. The derivative, f'(x), is:

f'(x) = 3x^2 - 8x + 3

The Newton-Raphson formula is:

x_new = x_old - f(x_old) / f'(x_old)

We start with an initial guess of x = 2 and iterate until the absolute error is less than 0.001.

Iteration 1:
x_old = 2
f(x_old) = (2)^3 - 4(2)^2 + 3(2) + 1 = -7
f'(x_old) = 3(2)^2 - 8(2) + 3 = -5
x_new = x_old - f(x_old) / f'(x_old) = 2 - (-7) / (-5) = 2 + 1.4 = 3.4

Iteration 2:
x_old = 3.4
f(x_old) = (3.4)^3 - 4(3.4)^2 + 3(3.4) + 1 ≈ -1.144
f'(x_old) = 3(3.4)^2 - 8(3.4) + 3 ≈ 2.76
x_new = x_old - f(x_old) / f'(x_old) = 3.4 - (-1.144) / 2.76 ≈ 3.814

Iteration 3:
x_old = 3.814
f(x_old) ≈ 0.231
f'(x_old) ≈ 1.041
x_new = x_old - f(x_old) / f'(x_old) = 3.814 - 0.231 / 1.041 ≈ 3.791

Iteration 4:
x_old = 3.791
f(x_old) ≈ 0.0006
f'(x_old) ≈ 1.031
x_new = x_old - f(x_old) / f'(x_old) = 3.791 - 0.0006 / 1.031 ≈ 3.790

The absolute error between the last two iterations is |3.791 - 3.790| = 0.001, which is less than the specified error tolerance of 0.001. Therefore, the root of the function f(x) = x^3 - 4x^2 + 3x + 1 using the Newton-Raphson method with an initial guess of x = 2 is approximately x = 3.790.
